alert.note: Alert for Edmunds; Faulk (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 07 at 9:59PM MDT until May 07 at 10:30PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR EASTERN EDMUNDS AND NORTHERN FAULK COUNTIES... At 1059 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms had produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain are estimated to have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ipswich, Cresbard, Seneca, Chelsea, Onaka, Blumengard Colony, Norbeck, Loyalton, Pembrook Colony, Brentwood Colony, Cravens Corner, North Scatterwood Lake and South Scatterwood Lake. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
